GTEST_INTERNAL_PARSE_FLAG
memberdef.initializer: do { \ auto value = GTEST_FLAG_GET(flag_name); \ if (ParseFlag(arg, #flag_name, &value)) { \ GTEST_FLAG_SET(flag_name, value); \ return true; \ } \ } while (false)

memberdef.argsstring: (fail_fast, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("fail_fast", testing::GetDefaultFailFast()), "True if and only if a test failure should stop further test execution.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if a test failure should stop further test execution."

memberdef.argsstring: (also_run_disabled_tests, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("also_run_disabled_tests", false), "Run disabled tests too, in addition to the tests normally being run.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: in addition to the tests normally being run."

memberdef.argsstring: (break_on_failure, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("break_on_failure", false), "True if and only if a failed assertion should be a debugger " "break-point.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if a failed assertion should be a debugger " "break-point."

memberdef.argsstring: (catch_exceptions, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("catch_exceptions", true), "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " should catch exceptions and treat them as test failures.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " should catch exceptions and treat them as test failures."

memberdef.argsstring: (color, testing::internal::StringFromGTestEnv("color", "auto"), "Whether to use colors in the output. Valid values: yes, no, " "and auto. 'auto' means to use colors if the output is " "being sent to a terminal and the TERM environment variable " "is set to a terminal type that supports colors.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_string_

param.type: "Whether to use colors in the output. Valid values:
" "and auto. 'auto' means to use colors if the output is " "being sent to a terminal and the TERM environment variable " "is set to a terminal type that supports colors."

memberdef.argsstring: (filter, testing::internal::StringFromGTestEnv("filter", testing::GetDefaultFilter()), "A colon-separated list of glob (not regex) patterns " "for filtering the tests to run, optionally followed by a " "'-' and a : separated list of negative patterns (tests to " "exclude). A test is run if it matches one of the positive " "patterns and does not match any of the negative patterns.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_string_

param.type: "A colon-separated list of glob (not regex) patterns " "for filtering the tests to

optionally followed by a " "'-' and a :separated list of negative patterns(tests to " "exclude). A test is run if it matches one of the positive " "patterns and does not match any of the negative patterns."

memberdef.argsstring: (install_failure_signal_handler, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("install_failure_signal_handler", false), "If true and supported on the current platform, " GTEST_NAME_ " should " "install a signal handler that dumps debugging information when fatal " "signals are raised.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "If true and supported on the current
" GTEST_NAME_ " should " "install a signal handler that dumps debugging information when fatal " "signals are raised."

memberdef.argsstring: (list_tests, false, "List all tests without running them.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

memberdef.argsstring: (output, testing::internal::StringFromGTestEnv("output", testing::internal::OutputFlagAlsoCheckEnvVar().c_str()), "A format (defaults to \"xml\" but can be specified to be \"json\"), " "optionally followed by a colon and an output file name or directory. " "A directory is indicated by a trailing pathname separator. " "Examples: \"xml:filename.xml\", \"xml::directoryname/\". " "If a directory is specified, output files will be created " "within that directory, with file-names based on the test " "executable's name and, if necessary, made unique by adding " "digits.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_string_

param.array: defaults to \"xml\" but can be specified to be \"json\"

param.type: " "optionally followed by a colon and an output file name or directory. " "A directory is indicated by a trailing pathname separator. " "Examples:\"xml:filename.xml\"
output files will be created " "within that
with file-names based on the test " "executable 's name

memberdef.argsstring: (brief, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("brief", false), "True if only test failures should be displayed in text output.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if only test failures should be displayed in text output."

memberdef.argsstring: (print_time, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("print_time", true), "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " should display elapsed time in text output.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " should display elapsed time in text output."

memberdef.argsstring: (print_utf8, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("print_utf8", true), "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " prints UTF8 characters as text.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " prints UTF8 characters as text."

memberdef.argsstring: (random_seed, testing::internal::Int32FromGTestEnv("random_seed", 0), "Random number seed to use when shuffling test orders. Must be in range " "[1, 99999], or 0 to use a seed based on the current time.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_int32_

param.type: "Random number seed to use when shuffling test orders. Must be in range " "
or 0 to use a seed based on the current time."

memberdef.argsstring: (repeat, testing::internal::Int32FromGTestEnv("repeat", 1), "How many times to repeat each test. Specify a negative number " "for repeating forever. Useful for shaking out flaky tests.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_int32_

param.type: "How many times to repeat each test. Specify a negative number " "for repeating forever. Useful for shaking out flaky tests."

memberdef.argsstring: (recreate_environments_when_repeating, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("recreate_environments_when_repeating", false), "Controls whether global test environments are recreated for each repeat " "of the tests. If set to false the global test environments are only set " "up once, for the first iteration, and only torn down once, for the last. " "Useful for shaking out flaky tests with stable, expensive test " "environments. If --gtest_repeat is set to a negative number, meaning " "there is no last run, the environments will always be recreated to avoid " "leaks.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "Controls whether global test environments are recreated for each repeat " "of the tests. If set to false the global test environments are only set " "up
for the last. " "Useful for shaking out flaky tests with
expensive test " "environments. If --gtest_repeat is set to a negative
the environments will always be recreated to avoid " "leaks."

memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " should include internal stack frames when " "printing test failure stack traces."

memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: "True if and only if " GTEST_NAME_ " should randomize tests' order on every run."

param.type: "The maximum number of stack frames to print when an " "assertion fails. The valid range is 0 through

memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_string_

param.type: "This flag specifies the host name and the port number on which to stream " "test results. Example: \"localhost:555\". The flag is effective only on " "Linux."

memberdef.argsstring: (throw_on_failure, testing::internal::BoolFromGTestEnv("throw_on_failure", false), "When this flag is specified, a failed assertion will throw an exception " "if exceptions are enabled or exit the program with a non-zero code " "otherwise. For use with an external test framework.")
memberdef.name: GTEST_DEFINE_bool_

param.type: a failed assertion will throw an exception " "if exceptions are enabled or exit the program with a non-zero code " "otherwise. For use with an external test framework."
